alert.note: Alert for Holmes; Knox; Mahoning; Stark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 03 at 3:49AM EST until February 04 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 9 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Holmes, Stark, Mahoning and Knox counties. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and especially the Thursday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain continues to transition to freezing rain and sleet over the next hour or two before changing to all snow by daybreak. This quicker transition to snow has allowed for a slightly higher snowfall forecast for today. Snow will increase in intensity and coverage late this morning into the afternoon as the next wave of snow enters from the southwest. Snowfall rates of one half inch to one inch per hour are possible this afternoon. Low temperatures tonight will reach the lower teens and wind chill values as low as zero degrees are expected.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
